page.title: 18IRON ORE, RAILWAY, COTTAGES
page.content: The iron ore industry was once very important in the area and this can be seen in the place names e.g. Cinder Banks, Kiln Wood, and Burnt Place. The railway goes through Cinder Banks which is a charcoal burning site. The Tunnel cottages were first built for the people who, in the 1800s, built the Balcombe Tunnel. Railway workers still live there. One of the present occupants is an ex railway employee. Near the houses is an air shaft. In the winter the tunnel caused the London to Brighton Line to be closed because there were icicles falling from the shaft. The people who live in a house called Wagon Wheels said that when they moved in 25 years ago there was very little traffic along the road but now the High Street is a dangerous and busy road. There are no local shops and no bus service.
